articles.title: How to see the rare green comet approaching Earth for the first time in 50,000 years - Lifestyle Asia Hong Kong
articles.description: The rare green comet that can be spotted in the sky is named C/ 2022 E3 (ZTF) and it hasn’t entered the Earth since the last ice age.
articles.content: The solar system, space and all that make up the vast expanse of the universe has always been a subject of great fascination to humans. And, when it comes to spotting a ‘notoriously unpredictable’ an… [+4211 chars]

articles.title: Nearly 220 million people in Pakistan without power after countrywide outage - CNN
articles.description: A nationwide power outage in Pakistan left nearly 220 million people without electricity on Monday, threatening to cause havoc in the South Asian nation already grappling with fuel shortages in the winter months.

articles.title: Vinyl record collecting is having a resurgence in Singapore – what does 'stan culture' have to do it? - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: From Teresa Teng to Billie Eilish, record collecting is enjoying a renaissance in Singapore. We asked the folks at Roxy Records, Wildflower Wax Co and Vinyl Kakis – who’s buying them and, more importantly, why?
articles.content: And then theres stan culture. A portmanteau of stalker and fan (and a nod to the Eminem song Stan), the phenomenon now commonly associated with K-pop fans emerged in the late 2010s and became more co… [+1261 chars]

articles.title: Celebrating Lunar New Year around the world - CBC.ca
articles.description: Asian people in Canada and around the world are celebrating Lunar New Year, which begins Sunday.
articles.content:
Chinese Lunar New Year begins Sunday, according to the lunisolar calendar. And this year it's the Year of the Rabbit  one of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac.
